description: Entire Russula has reddish-brown cap (5-12 cm), smooth. Gills yellowish. Stem white, often tinged reddish. KEY: BRITTLE FLESH, ENTIRE (non-peeling) cuticle, yellowish gills. Flesh white. Spore print yellow-ochre. Mild taste.
habitat: Mycorrhizal with conifers, especially pine, fir, spruce. Grows on ground in coniferous forests. Northern species. Scattered.
lookalikes: Other Russulas - check cuticle and spore print
safety_notes: EDIBLE: Mild flavor. REDDISH CAP + YELLOW GILLS + BRITTLE FLESH + MILD TASTE diagnostic. Cook thoroughly.
